title.narrative: Enhancing Muslim intra-faith understanding and dialogue (Research and MandE components from CAFOD)

description.narrative:
Currently the Muslim community, which makes up 4.3% of the population (2014 census), is disconnected in its intra-faith understanding and promotion of minority rights. To foster a culture of peace between different faith communities, it is essential that grassroots Islamic leaders and the Muslim community have an increased understanding of their rights as a religious minority. This project will bring together Muslims from different denominations through dialogues, trainings and exposure visits focusing on self-awareness, tolerance and non-violence leading to a greater understanding of themselves and their rights as a minority group.
Using a rights-based approach, this project will equip and empower Muslim leaders and communities with the knowledge and skills to develop action plans to protect and promote their rights with a united voice. Developing a common understanding of faith and religion (including theology, context and a rights perspective) within each group is a key step to engaging in constructive inter-faith dialogues, and therefore contributing to functional coexistence and a culture of peace.
